arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Dinamo Zagreb; Arsenal eyeing Real Madrid star; Ivan Perišić headed to PSV?; Real Madrid wants FC Barcelona defender; Harry Kane gets European acclaim; and MORE!
arts.sum: Bayern Munich thrashed Dinamo Zagreb in a match that the Bavarians dominated from start-to-finish. Harry Kane eventually deposited the penalty kick into the net for a 1-0 Bayern Munich lead in the 19th minute.

arts.ttl: Player ratings: Bayern Munich 9-2 Dinamo Zagreb
arts.sum: Maybe they shouldn’t have, though, as the two Zagreb goals in the second half, which momentarily cut the Bayern lead to 3-2, seemed to ignite a fire and fury in the home side...who did not rest until the final whistle. How many offside goals can you score in a game?

arts.ttl: Is he hurt? Vincent Kompany explains why Bayern Munich subbed Manuel Neuer at halftime
arts.sum: Early in the match, Bayern captain Manuel Neuer flew out of the box for one of his patented sweeper keeper clearances near midfield. In his postgame interview (via @iMiaSanMia ), Bayern manager Vincent Kompany said, “It was a precaution.

arts.ttl: “Amazing game!” — Harry Kane jubilant after scoring FOUR goals in Bayern Munich’s Champions League win over Dinamo Zagreb
arts.sum: Kane has four goals in three Bundesliga games to open the year, and ripped off four more in a single game in Bayern’s Champions League opener, a 9-2 win over Dinamo Zagreb on Tuesday. Today we got away with that bad start of the second half, but against top opposition we could get punished for that.”

arts.ttl: Three observations from Bayern Munich’s 9-2 win over Dinamo Zagreb
arts.sum: Defense has not been Bayern’s strong suit in some years now, but it is certainly something Kompany and team will need to improve. 11 goals scored in a spectacular fashion to start off Bayern Munich’s Champions League campaign.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show: Bayern Munich 9-2 Dinamo Zagreb (UEFA Champions League)
arts.sum: In this episode of the Bavarian Podcast Works Postgame Show, Cyler (Rayyan) breaks down the game, what went wrong (if anything), what went right (mostly everything), and how Kompany could look to adapt the team with the current injury issues. How Kompany set up Bayern’s build-up structure to account for Zagreb’s shape, and how the players adapted to changes.

arts.ttl: Harry Kane salutes Wayne Rooney after breaking English Champions League record
arts.sum: Kane is the competition’s top-scoring Englishman after scoring four as Bayern hit Dinamo Zagreb for nine to launch their campaign in style.

arts.ttl: Transfer Talk: Man United, West Ham eyeing Bayern's Goretzka
arts.sum: Two Premier League clubs are monitoring the situation of Bayern Munich midfielder Leon Goretzka, reports The Sun . Multiple clubs including Liverpool, Real Madrid, and Arsenal are reported to be among the sides keen on the 21-year-old, but it looks as though the Citizens have got themselves to the front of the queue.

arts.ttl: Match awards from Bayern Munich’s sensational 9-2 Champions League win over Dinamo Zagreb
arts.sum: Guerreiro was tasked with filling the attacking half space between Jamal Musiala and Michael Olise, plus tracking back to cover the random bursts forward by Takuya Ogiwara. Before Olise scored his first career Champions League goal, he was already giving the Dinamo Zagreb defense fits with his stop-and-go dribbling.

arts.ttl: Kompany reveals reason for taking Neuer off in 9-2 win over Dinamo Zagreb
arts.sum: After Bayern Munich's 9-2 win over Dinamo Zagreb, Vincent Kompany explained why Manuel Neuer was taken off at half-time and reflected on the performance.
